title: Starlink Cuts Monthly Fee in Latest Bid to Attract New US Customers
description: New users in select locations can now sign up for the Residential plan for $99 per month, down from $120. The Residential Lite plan also gets a price drop.
content:
SpaceX is taking the rare step of slashing Starlink's monthly fee in its latest effort to attract new customers in the US.

In certain locations, new customers can now sign up for the Residential plan for $99 per month, down from $120. New customers can also get a discount on the Residential Lite plan, which drops from $80 per month to $65.

“Offer is valid for new customers only. Discount will apply to one service line,” SpaceX says. "The service promotional offering varies by location. Other terms and conditions may apply. Terms and duration are subject to change."

Another important condition is that the discount only lasts for the first year of service. After that, the normal monthly fee will kick in, according to a Starlink support page.

SpaceX hasn’t clearly said where the discount is being offered. But it appears to be available in over two dozen US states where Starlink has excess capacity and offers Residential Lite.

This comes after Starlink.com started offering eligible new sign-ups in the US a free Starlink dish , which usually costs $349. In return, interested customers had to subscribe for 12 months.

Although SpaceX wound down the free dish offer, the company has returned with this service discount, an apparent first. The deal means that over 12 months, a Residential plan subscriber will save $252; a Residential Lite user will save $180.

On the downside, interested new customers will need to pay for the standard Starlink dish rather than receive it for free. However, the company has decided to discount the hardware nationwide from $349 to $175. The offer is available via Starlink.com, Walmart, and Best Buy .

SpaceX recently revealed that Starlink’s customer base in the US has grown to over 2 million, up from 1.4 million a year ago. Outside the US, the company has been spotted offering the same discount on the monthly fee in Canada, Australia, and New Zealand.
summary: SpaceX is reducing its monthly fee for Starlink to attract new customers in the US, with the Residential plan costing $99 per month, down from $120, and the Residential Lite plan dropping from $80 per month to $65. The discount is available in over two dozen US states where Starlink has excess capacity and offers Residential Lite. However, the discount only lasts for the first year of service and will revert back to the normal monthly fee after that. This is not the first time SpaceX has offered a discount for new customers, but it is available only in certain locations. The company has also announced that its US customer base has grown to over 2 million, up from 1.4 million a year ago.
shortSummary: SpaceX is cutting monthly fees for new customers, including Residential Lite, to attract more customers, following a similar offer for free service.

Note: Customers on a Residential service for 12 months must contact customer support to make any changes to their service plan. A Change Fee will apply, which may be either pro-rated or a flat rate depending on the market, and will be charged in the month the change takes effect. However, if Residential Lite is offered and you switch to this plan, no Change Fee will be charged. For details about your specific Change Fee and other important information, please refer to the 12-month Residential confirmation email you received after placing your order. argos_summary: SpaceX has reduced the monthly fee for its Starlink service in the US, with the Residential plan now available for $99 (down from $120) and the Residential Lite plan for $65 (down from $80) for new customers. This discount is valid for the first year of service and is available in select states where Starlink has excess capacity. Additionally, the cost of the Starlink dish has been lowered from $349 to $175, although customers will need to purchase it rather than receiving it for free.
